<NEW>

WHEELIE was def=
initely right in the aspect that anyone with reasonable
communication skill=
s and had the gear to do it with could simulate a
distress call from any of=
 the opposing factions. It has been used as a
lure for many centuries with =
varying degrees of success.

But, be that as it may, WHEELIE continued down=
 the path. The
interesting thing was as he moved he could note that had bee=
n
flattened down as if some large vehicle had recently driven down it,
perh=
aps within the past day or so. It allowed him to shift to
vehicular mode an=
d to make greater speed.

As he drove the path began to open up as tree dis=
tance allowed for the
path to enlarge somewhat, his sensors now able to pic=
k up what might
appear to be a structure of some type. It was from here tha=
t the
signal was being broadcast.

As he drove figures would seem to be on =
the path with him on or behind
the trees he passed. It was like shadows or =
plays of light =96 you see
it out of the corner of the optic, but when one =
focused on it, it was
gone.

In the distance a roar echoed over the forest,=
 and then several
smaller ones. From the sound of it, it was coming from fa=
r behind
WHEELIE, somewhere in the distance several miles away or more. How=
ever
ahead of him a small pyramid of some sort was becoming visible, and
th=
e path he was on seemed to be heading straight for it.
